chargeHist.descr: Violate No Contact Court Order (Misdemeanor Conviction)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Violate No Contact Court Order (Misdemeanor Conviction)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yolanda S Huston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yolanda S Huston in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Yolanda S Huston.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Yolanda S Huston appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court in person for Yolanda S Huston.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #21CM2979.  Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Officer K. Webster. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Yolanda S Huston not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Yolanda S Huston not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with KOG (11/27/2012) and LJG
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Yolanda S Huston
Current: 2915 N 8th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 07-05-2022)
Prior: 7129 West Beloit Road, West Allis, WI 53219

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER for Electronic Monitoring. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Yolanda S Huston in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Yolanda S Huston in custody.  Nate K. McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yolanda S Huston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1 and 3. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
